processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the John H. Squires Papers was completed prior to 2011. Additional description was completed in March 2011 and October 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John H. Squires was a native of North Carolina and later worked there as a banker for Union National Bank. Squires was educated at Virginia Tech (B.S., Agriculture, 1905; M.S., 1906) and later attended Cornell University (Ph.D., 1909). He also donated the funds for building Virginia Tech's student union, now Squires Student Center. Squires died March 14, 1934.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains papers relating to Squires' will with affidavits, notes regarding stocks, correspondence, his diplomas from Virginia Tech and Cornell University, and a certificate from the Nobles of the Mystic Shrine. Correspondence with Julian Burruss indicates Squires donated money to Virginia Polytechnic Institute at the time of his death. The collection also includes a copy of his will with supporting documentation and several diplomas and a certificate.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is in chronological order. Undated materials are at the end.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The Map of Caldwell County, NC, 1931 (Map.0429) was transferred to the Historical Map Collection, Special Collections.
